sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"压力，重压，紧张"之意。
means: strain ： 指某人为克服外力界压力而造成的身心和情绪等方面的压抑。用于物时，指任何力或合力作用于一个物体上面造成的应变。
stress ： 侧重指承受外来的压力，也指由于某种原因而引起的心理、生理或情绪上的紧张。
pressure ： 在科学上，指单位面积上所受到的压力。用于引申时，指某事物所产生的压力或影响力等。
tension ： 多指因关系不好或其它原因而出现的紧张状态，也指某物被过度伸展的程度或状态。

word_mean: 肌牵张过度，肌用力过度
株，特种：同一种或一类微生物中具有某种特性的群体，如细菌的粗糙或平滑株
物体内任一点因各种作用引起的相对变形。
源出于一个共同的祖先而且具有特定基因型的动植物或微生物。

sentence.Network_en: The whole ship shuddered and trembled at the sudden strain.
sentence.Network_cn: 突然的拉力使得整只船剧烈颤动。

sentence.Network_en: There was a strain of bitterness in his voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的声音听起来有些愤愤不平。

sentence.Network_en: Her voice was so low he had to strain to catch it.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的声音很低，他很费力才听得到。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb): from Old French estreindre, from Latin stringere 'draw tight'. Current senses of the noun arose in the mid 16th cent
Old English strīon 'acquisition, gain', of Germanic origin; related to Latin struere 'to build up'

entry.def: If strain is put on an organization or system, it has to do more than it is able to do.

example.ex: The prison service is already under considerable strain...
example.tran: 监狱系统已经承受了巨大的压力。

example.ex: The vast expansion in secondary education is putting an enormous strain on the system.
example.tran: 中等教育的大幅扩张正对该系统造成巨大压力。

entry.def: To strain something means to make it do more than it is able to do.

example.ex: The volume of scheduled flights is straining the air traffic control system...
example.tran: 定期航班的数量正让空中交通指挥系统不堪重负。

example.ex: Resources will be further strained by new demands for housing.
example.tran: 资源将因新的住房需求而变得更紧张。

entry.def: Strain is a state of worry and tension caused by a difficult situation.

example.ex: She was tired and under great strain.
example.tran: 她身心疲惫，压力很大。

example.ex: ...the stresses and strains of a busy and demanding career.
example.tran: 忙碌而辛苦的工作带来的巨大压力

entry.tran: 带来压力的情况;造成紧张的因素
entry.def: If you say that a situation is a strain, you mean that it makes you worried and tense.

example.ex: I sometimes find it a strain to be responsible for the mortgage.
example.tran: 我有时觉得背负这笔抵押贷款很有压力。

entry.tran: 应力;张力;拉力;作用力;压力
entry.def: Strain is a force that pushes, pulls, or stretches something in a way that may damage it.

example.ex: Place your hands under your buttocks to take some of the strain off your back...
example.tran: 将手放在臀部下面，减轻背部的一些压力。

example.ex: A build-up of strain on a section of the San Andreas Fault has been detected.
example.tran: 已经勘测到圣安德烈亚斯断层的其中一处所承受的拉力在增强。

entry.def: Strain is an injury to a muscle in your body, caused by using the muscle too much or twisting it.

example.ex: Avoid muscle strain by warming up with slow jogging.
example.tran: 先慢跑热热身，免得拉伤肌肉。

example.ex: ...a groin strain.
example.tran: 腹股沟拉伤

entry.def: If you strain a muscle, you injure it by using it too much or twisting it.

example.ex: He strained his back during a practice session.
example.tran: 他在一次锻炼中扭伤了背部。

entry.tran: 努力做;竭力做;费力做事
entry.def: If you strain to do something, you make a great effort to do it when it is difficult to do.

example.ex: I had to strain to hear...
example.tran: 我不得不使劲去听。

example.ex: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president...
example.tran: 几千名支持者翘首企盼能一睹新总统的风采。

entry.tran: 过滤;滤掉(食物中)的液体
entry.def: When you strain food, you separate the liquid part of it from the solid parts.

example.ex: Strain the stock and put it back into the pan.
example.tran: 滤出原汁，将它放回到平底锅中。

entry.def: You can use strain to refer to a particular quality in someone's character, remarks, or work.

example.ex: There was a strain of bitterness in his voice.
example.tran: 他的声音听起来有些愤愤不平。

example.ex: ...this cynical strain in the book.
example.tran: 该书中这种愤世嫉俗的意味

entry.tran: (病菌的)类型;(植物或其他有机物的)系，品系，品种
entry.def: A strain of a germ, plant, or other organism is a particular type of it.

example.ex: Every year new strains of influenza develop.
example.tran: 每年都有新的流感病毒出现。

example.ex: ...a particularly beautiful strain of Swiss pansies.
example.tran: 一种格外美丽的瑞士三色堇

entry.def: If you hear the strains of music, you hear music being played.

example.ex: She could hear the tinny strains of a chamber orchestra.
example.tran: 她能听见室内管弦乐队尖细的旋律。

means.word_mean: 1. (physics) deformation of a physical body under the action of applied forces
2. difficulty that causes worry or emotional tension;

sentences.sentence: "she endured the stresses and strains of life"
"he presided over the economy during the period of the greatest stress and danger"- R.J.Samuelson

means.word_mean: 3. a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence;

sentences.sentence: "she was humming an air from Beethoven"

means.word_mean: 4. (psychology) nervousness resulting from mental stress;

sentences.sentence: "the mental strain of staying alert hour after hour was too much for him"

means.word_mean: 5. a special variety of domesticated animals within a species;

sentences.sentence: "he experimented on a particular breed of white rats"
"he created a new strain of sheep"

means.word_mean: 6. (biology) a group of organisms within a species that differ in trivial ways from similar groups;
7. a lineage or race of people
8. injury to a muscle (often caused by overuse); results in swelling and pain
9. pervading note of an utterance;

sentences.sentence: "I could follow the general tenor of his argument"

means.word_mean: 10. an effortful attempt to attain a goal
11. an intense or violent exertion
12. the act of singing;

sentences.sentence: "with a shout and a song they marched up to the gates"

means.word_mean: 1. to exert much effort or energy;
2. test the limits of;
3. use to the utmost; exert vigorously or to full capacity;

sentences.sentence: "He really extended himself when he climbed Kilimanjaro"

means.word_mean: 4. separate by passing through a sieve or other straining device to separate out coarser elements;
5. make tense and uneasy or nervous or anxious;
6. stretch or force to the limit;
7. remove by passing through a filter;
8. rub through a strainer or process in an electric blender;
9. alter the shape of (something) by stress;

Sentence.sentence: See a doctor about her strained shoulder.
According to two recent studies, randomly assigned roommates of different races are more likely to experience conflicts so strained that one roommate will move out.
Two strains of the disease, with almost identical symptoms, affected humans-Ebola-Zaire and Ebola-Sudan.

Both strains quickly invaded local hospitals when needle sharing and other unhealthy practices ensured the rapid spreading of the infection by bringing people into contact with contaminated body fluids
More strains will evolve from the Ebola virus.

means.word_mean: 拉紧

sentences.en: They strained the wire between two posts.
sentences.cn: 他们拉紧了两根电线杆之间的电线。

means.word_mean: 过滤

sentences.en: I boiled the potatoes and then strained them.
sentences.cn: 我把土豆煮熟后把水滤掉。

means.word_mean: 拉力; 张力; 应变

sentences.en: The strain on the rope made it broken.
sentences.cn: 绳子因受力过大而断了。

means.word_mean: 使(物资)耗尽，使紧张

sentences.en: The supply of oil has been strained.
sentences.cn: 石油供给几乎到了危机的边缘。

means.word_mean: 使过度劳累；(因过度劳累而)拉伤，扭伤，使损伤

sentences.en: He strained his muscle in the match.
sentences.cn: 他在那次比赛中拉伤了肌肉。

jushi.english: He strained to turn the wheel, but he couldn't.
jushi.chinese: 他使劲转动车轮子,但没有成功。
